answers.answer: Hi! I was diagnosed when I was 13 (now 28) and have no immediate family members with Type 1. I've been told that there is a high likelihood of your children not having the disease but since they don't really know what causes it yet, I'd say put your faith in finding a cure?On the other hand, Chip77 wrote something in a Complications thread saying he has 3 healthy children...

I went out to Google and did a search ondiabetes genetic probability "Type 1"The first article talks a little about it - There seems to be a higher incidence in children with diabetic parents, but it's not a sure thing. I have Type 1 (since age 3) but I had a diabetic great aunt, and my grandmother, while saying we had no family history, also likely wouldn't have told us if her ancestors did, as it would have been a "sign of weakness" - God forbid! :-)
Type one isnt inherited athough there is some evidence that type two is.

title: Inheriting Diabetes
